channel.title: Custom Recoloring (Ints)
channel.description:
Hey guys I was bored so I thought I would tell everyone how to recolor "[b]Custom[/b]" items through ints
well firstly you need to put your model in-game E.g. dat or GZip it in-game, then Un-Gzip it and export it to .Mqo again then you should notice that your matt id's have changed, they are now showing your int 156, also known as your original color, eg matt 1 has changed to matt 6674 etc, this can be used to get the original color ids for practically any model, now you just recolor with the ints how you would with any other model, then you compile and your done, here's some color ids that might be useful to color your ids to, lol yes I found them, there should be all colors there that you should need;
[CODE]491770 = White With Tint Of Blue 479770 = Camo Green 476770 = Icing Green 470770 = Neon Yellow With A Hint Of Lime Green 461770 = Deep Orange 428770 = Another Blue 422770 = Yet Another Nice Green 419770 = Nice Green 380770 = Pink 374770 = Shiny Purple 359770 = Blue 356770 = Dark Green 353770 = White Green 350770 = Forest Green 347770 = Neon Green 338770 = Another Nice Yellow 332770 = Nice Orange Color 311770 = Light Purple 305770 = Crayon Blue 302770 = Dark Blue 296770 = Blue Darker Than Cyan By Abit 290770 = Bluish Green 266770 = Bronze 257770 = Bright Pink 246770 = Pinky Purple 226770 = Aqua 210770 = Lime Green 34770 = Cyan 76770 = Nice Yellow 87770 = Nice Green 92770 = Neon Greenish Color 130770 = Pinky Red 129770 = Chewing Gum Pink 123770 = Pink 933 = Red[/CODE]
Yes this is encouraging you to "[b]Create[/b]" your own items.. Not recoloring capes anymore..

item.title: Custom Recoloring (Ints)
item.dc:creator: @h1_sk1ller h1 sk1ller
item.description:
@h1_sk1ller wrote:

the wanderer:

Much easier to recolor using hex code instead of cache Id imo.

Yeah but this I thought is for people who don’t know what hex code even is lol XD

Read full topic

item.title: Custom Recoloring (Ints)
item.dc:creator: @h1_sk1ller h1 sk1ller
item.description:
@h1_sk1ller wrote:

goldstylez:

can you add more of them?

Colors? I just chose them because that is all colors you should need, you can find more by changing that number in the region of -40,000 to +40,000 and it should be the same colors

Read full topic

item.title: Custom Recoloring (Ints)
item.dc:creator: @h1_sk1ller h1 sk1ller
item.description:
@h1_sk1ller wrote:

[quote=“reyx7, post:11, topic:361879”][quote author=h1 sk1ller link=topic=458158.msg3353607#msg3353607 date=1285558444]

this needs to go into the client hacking section as it doesnt specifically pertain to models. Its more of integers you add to an item config to change a model’s color. Thus being a client hack.

Hmmmm, it’s sorta debatable XD it fits in the models section because its to do with custom item recolor’s but idk XD
[/quote]
I’d say it’s more toward the client hacking section. No knowledge of models is required for this.[/quote]

Hmmm yeah I guess you’re right, even though you should have modeling knowledge as it’s sort of encouraging people to make custom items and recolor with ints to learn more about modeling and ints etc…

Read full topic

Well I think Recolors from ints are good B/c it gives new servers with No Skill to create much less make ints for Customs to have somthing difernt in there servers…ik the dragon whip (which is just a recolor of The abyssal one is a big hit in some Private servers) Thank you H1 sk1ller Rep++
[/quote]

customs = gay[/quote] everyone has there opinion…if its good enough for jagex why not for other people…haha but what i dont understand…is the Real RS has Crap ass models yet they have professional modelers…When there are people here who just start out doing better models then the pros can…Im sure is all of Mopar got together With all of our Modeling and Coding Skills together could make a massive game (sorry for spam tho

@h1_sk1ller wrote:

Hey guys I was bored so I thought I would tell everyone how to recolor “Custom” items through ints

well firstly you need to put your model in-game E.g. dat or GZip it in-game, then Un-Gzip it and export it to .Mqo again then you should notice that your matt id’s have changed, they are now showing your int 156, also known as your original color, eg matt 1 has changed to matt 6674 etc, this can be used to get the original color ids for practically any model, now you just recolor with the ints how you would with any other model, then you compile and your done, here’s some color ids that might be useful to color your ids to, lol yes I found them, there should be all colors there that you should need;

491770 = White With Tint Of Blue 479770 = Camo Green 476770 = Icing Green 470770 = Neon Yellow With A Hint Of Lime Green 461770 = Deep Orange 428770 = Another Blue 422770 = Yet Another Nice Green 419770 = Nice Green 380770 = Pink 374770 = Shiny Purple 359770 = Blue 356770 = Dark Green 353770 = White Green 350770 = Forest Green 347770 = Neon Green 338770 = Another Nice Yellow 332770 = Nice Orange Color 311770 = Light Purple 305770 = Crayon Blue 302770 = Dark Blue 296770 = Blue Darker Than Cyan By Abit 290770 = Bluish Green 266770 = Bronze 257770 = Bright Pink 246770 = Pinky Purple 226770 = Aqua 210770 = Lime Green 34770 = Cyan 76770 = Nice Yellow 87770 = Nice Green 92770 = Neon Greenish Color 130770 = Pinky Red 129770 = Chewing Gum Pink 123770 = Pink 933 = Red
